title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of fatalities, with a total of 13 data points.
Overall Number of fatalities has decreased over the Year.

Number of fatalities is roughly constant from 2006 to 2007, gradually decreasing from 2007 to 2010, slightly increasing from 2010 to 2011, slightly decreasing from 2011 to 2012, and lastly roughly constant from 2012 to 2018.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2009 and 2010.
Max Number of fatalities about 5091.0 was recorded at Year 2006
Min Number of fatalities about 3180.0 was recorded at Year 2017
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of fatalities, with a total of 13 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2006 to 2011.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2015 to 2018.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2013 to 2015.
Also, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2011 to 2013.
